import { Invert, FullScreenCode, Appear } from "mdx-deck"
import { hack, swiss } from 'mdx-deck/themes'
import { deep } from "@theme-ui/presets"
import { Flex, Close, Spinner, Button, Box, Heading } from '@theme-ui/components'
import Newsletter from "./Newsletter" 
import Header from "./header"
import Center from "./center"
import myTheme from "./theme"
AKA what I have been waiting for...
Theme-UI Is not a CSS in JS Library
In fact its built on top of Emotion! üë©‚Äçüé§
Theme-UI is complete library built around creating themeable components.
It provides you a system for creating themes, and components that can be driven by them.

<Header>
  Where does the power come from?
</Header>
Theme UI has an optional Package of Components.
It includes stuff like Inputs, Buttons, Loading Spinners, and much more!

Styling these components is very easy! 
They are styled right on the theme object
You can define responsive styles just by using arrays!
You can also define your own breakpoints!

scopeImports: import { Flex, Close, Spinner, Button, Box, Heading } from '@theme-ui/components'
